The Senate just passed the #PACTAct, finally ensuring that our veterans exposed to toxic burn pits will get the care they deserve. 

To all the veterans and their families who refused to give up or back down — this victory belongs to you. https://t.co/eM4pbauoKx
The Senate is about to pass the #PACTAct! Join us live on Capitol Hill as we celebrate with the advocates, veterans, and family members who made today's victory possible. https://t.co/plO5L54QGG

The executive order @POTUS signed today will do so much to protect kids and families. I'm particularly grateful that he's moved to prevent the use of conversion therapy and to stop discrimination against LGBTQ+ kids and foster families – measures I've long fought for!

Nearly 75% of guns in New York connected to a crime are trafficked from out of state. That's why I've fought for over 10 years to make gun trafficking a federal crime, and I'm proud this measure has been included in the bipartisan gun deal. https://t.co/Wv2Em8Aico

DACA has been a band-aid on our broken immigration system for ten years. Our Dreamers deserve better. It's long past time to open up a real pathway to citizenship. #NoSonOlvidados https://t.co/RFuafYirI3

DACA ha sido una solución de corto plazo en nuestro sistema de inmigración que a estado roto por una década. Nuestros “Dreamers” merecen algo mejor. Ya es hora de abrir un camino verdadero hacia la ciudadanía. #NoSonOlvidados
We're not giving up the fight to protect every American's reproductive freedom. But if your home state is attacking your access to care, New York State will be a haven for you.

The men and women exposed to toxic burn pits while serving our country deserve the health care and benefits they've earned. This week the Senate moved to bring the #PACTAct up for a vote. I'm calling on my fellow senators to finally get this bill across the finish line. https://t.co/YYryxnah4a

El #FABRICAct protegerá a los trabajadores de confección estadounidenses, devolverá los empleos de fabricación de prendas a los EE.UU. y revitalizará nuestra industria nacional de confección. Así es como lo haremos: https://t.co/Xp0qdhYS6d

With the Supreme Court poised to overturn #RoeVWade, we must protect our reproductive freedom. I joined 24 of my Senate colleagues to ask @POTUS to issue an executive order to work to protect and expand access to care. https://t.co/XMmlQsHnmq

Buffalo's East Side fought for years to get this Tops market. Now the shooting has pushed fresh, affordable food further out of reach. I'm fighting for more federal funding to help fill these food deserts and ensure every family can get the food they need. https://t.co/lwCbj0STLO

This isn't a Republican issue or a Democratic issue. If you answered the call of duty and you were exposed to toxic burn pits, we have an obligation to ensure you get the care you need. This is the cost of war – and I'm proud to fight beside @marcorubio to get this done. https://t.co/HFMHlnu0jK

Today I met with the families of the victims of the horrific shooting in Buffalo. We refuse to let the status quo continue. We must root out the cancer of white supremacy, and we must fight the gun violence devastating our communities. https://t.co/jjYhLunyEk

Ruth Whitfield’s life mattered. She mattered to her family and to her entire community. Her life should matter to us here in Congress too. I hope my colleagues listen to her son's heartbreaking plea. We must pass commonsense gun reform and root out the cancer of white supremacy. https://t.co/pAx8QtxOVm

I'll be live on @SquawkCNBC with @SenLummis to talk about the Responsible Financial Innovation Act, our bill to create a regulatory framework for digital assets. Tune in!

Today, @SenLummis and I are introducing the Responsible Financial Innovation Act, our bill to create a regulatory framework for digital assets. This bill will protect consumers and provide clarity and certainty to the industry and regulators. https://t.co/8zLdzEKd9H

Honored to speak with the Baptist Minister’s Conference of Buffalo & Vicinity. Our shared faith calls on us to carry each other's burdens, and that's what I plan to do. I'll keep working to fight food insecurity, gun violence, and racism until every family in Buffalo can thrive. https://t.co/4k5X8bQjAW

Today I joined @RepJoeMorelle in Rochester to push for the passage of the #PACTAct, which will help millions of service members and vets exposed to toxic burn pits. I’m calling on the Senate to pass this bill and get our brave men and women the health care they have earned. https://t.co/SyzcYDJhZf
@SenSchumer Congratulations! She’s beautiful.

Those harmed by exposure to toxic burn pits while serving in our nation’s military deserve justice. Today, I joined with vets and advocates to continue calling on Congress to pass the #PACTAct and get veterans and their families access to the health care and benefits they earned. https://t.co/lprIKDli5L

Our brave men and women in the military always answered the call of duty. But for far too long, we left them without the care they earned when they came home. It's time to pass the #PACTAct and get veterans exposed to toxic burn pits the health care they deserve. https://t.co/bHZxVXf4P0

Honored to be named a #Champion4Children in the @Campaign4Kids scorecard! I want a better future for my kids and all of our children, which is why I'll keep fighting for policies and legislation that make children a priority in our nation. #InvestInKids https://t.co/jyiJHDOroc

Today we #WearOrange to remember the thousands of Americans killed every year by guns, to honor their loved ones, and to stand with survivors of gun violence. Enough is enough — it's long past time to pass the commonsense gun reform we desperately need. https://t.co/b0NYtdmWhX

These men and women have served our country with courage and honor, and they represent the best of America. I was proud to join them as they took their oaths and officially became American citizens. https://t.co/71A20XF9Xs

Our obligation to our veterans doesn't end once they finish their service. I joined @johnfeal2, @Burnpit360, @ReserveOrg, and @iava to call on the Senate to pass the #PACTAct and ensure veterans exposed to toxic burn pits get the care they have earned. https://t.co/UWqgIY6NfA

It was an honor to join these New Yorkers - including 8 service members - as they took their citizenship oath today. With tremendous courage and strength, they've already shown what it means to truly be an American citizen, and we are so grateful for their service to our country. https://t.co/B7EUbrszHP

Happy #PrideMonth, New York! New Yorkers have led the way in the fight for equality - and we're still fighting to ensure that everyone, no matter where they live, can live openly, proudly, and without fear. https://t.co/804yV4MWH7

Proud to work with @GovKathyHochul, @SenSchumer, @SecretaryPete, and @POTUS to finally make this happen! It's time to replace the I-81 viaduct and reconnect communities that have been divided for far too long.

Proud to stand with @RepYvetteClarke and @ANHDNYC at Caton Flats, a new affordable housing development in Brooklyn, to announce I'm joining her to introduce the Affordable Housing and Area Median Income Fairness Act, which will help more families get safe and affordable housing! https://t.co/6cehkB5RqL

It’s been an honor to fight beside you and your family to pass the #PACTAct, @SusanZeier. You’ve made sure that Heath’s service and sacrifice will never be forgotten. Millions of veterans and their families will forever be grateful that you refused to give up on this fight.

This Memorial Day we honor and remember the brave members of our armed services who gave their lives in service to our country. Their sacrifices to keep our nation safe, secure, and free will never be forgotten.

For far too long, we've failed to do right by those who have made great sacrifices on our behalf. No more — justice for America’s military men and women must begin now. @marcorubio and I are calling on our colleagues in Congress to pass the #PACTAct now.  https://t.co/uMNrcqPm5I
I'll be live soon with @Everytown, @MomsDemand, @StudentsDemand, and @shannonrwatts at a rally outside the Senate for commonsense gun reform. Join us: https://t.co/SJzXTW9srA

Thank you, @POTUS. As we mark the second anniversary of George Floyd's murder today, I'm not giving up on the fight to pass the George Floyd Justice in Policing Act. And we must keep working to dismantle the systemic abuses that have led to the deaths of too many Black Americans.

General Lee Avenue in Fort Hamilton, Brooklyn has been renamed after First Lt. John Earl Warren Jr., a true American hero posthumously awarded the Medal of Honor. I first requested a change to this street name in 2020, and I'm thrilled it's finally done. https://t.co/iqLGR5nVMe

My message to Justices Alito, Gorsuch, Thomas, Barrett, and Kavanaugh: Respect our voices. Respect our choices. Respect our rights to life, liberty, and equal justice under the law.

So relieved to hear that you’re doing well. Rest up, and I can’t wait to see you back in the Senate soon!
I'll be joining @POTUS and @FLOTUS in Buffalo tomorrow to honor the memories of the ten people who were murdered in a racist mass shooting and to grieve with their families and the entire community.

Today I spoke with the FBI about the tragic shooting in Buffalo. They told me that they’re investigating this act of violence as a hate crime and will investigate this fully and comprehensively. We must take action to prevent domestic terrorism fueled by white supremacy.
I pledge to the people of New York that I will continue to fight my hardest to pass commonsense gun safety measures and to confront and defeat the scourge of white supremacy. 2/2

My prayers are with the victims of this racially motivated act of violence and my heart goes out to the victims' loved ones, our emergency personnel and the entire Buffalo community. Racism, prejudice and hatred have no place in our state or our country. 1/2

This is an issue that is defining for this country today. Women deserve freedom and bodily autonomy. We deserve to be able to make decisions about when we are having children, under what circumstances we are having children, and how many children we are having.
I’ve been saying it, and I’ll keep saying it.

There is no state where a majority of the public supports a federal ban on abortion. In purple and red states, we must fight tooth and nail to flip legislatures and pass legislation guaranteeing reproductive rights, including access to abortion.

#SCOTUS’ leaked draft majority opinion overturning #RoeVWade is an affront to women everywhere. This draft ruling is not just about access to reproductive health care – it is about the fundamental right to bodily autonomy.

The leaked draft majority opinion overturning Roe v. Wade reveals that the Supreme Court's right-wing majority is poised to destroy the fundamental human and reproductive rights of millions of women, willfully disregarding public opinion and court precedent. 

My statement--> https://t.co/hVTfVYjFO0

I believe that we all have the right to clean air and clean water, and that all of our children deserve to grow up in safe, livable communities. This #EarthDay, let's fight the climate crisis, protect our families, and preserve our beautiful state for future generations to enjoy.

Thanks for joining us at our New York City office today, @AARPNY! I'm proud to be fighting alongside you to bring down the cost of prescription drugs for every New York family.

New York legalized marijuana and is expunging possession and sale convictions. 

This is what justice looks like – and it's what every American deserves. It's time for the Senate to pass the MORE Act, legalize marijuana across the country, and expunge all non-violent convictions.

🧹 Begin Clean-Up 🧹

Make sure your home is structurally safe to re-enter. Clean and dry everything thoroughly to prevent mold growth. Disinfect all surfaces with a dilute bleach solution. In NYC, call 311 if you need help removing standing water or preventing mold growth.

📸 Document Everything 📸

Take photos and videos of your flood-damaged home, business, and belongings. Show flood water lines on the outside and inside of the building. For appliances and electronics, take a photograph of the make, model, and serial number.

📝 File a Claim 📝

If you have insurance, you must file a claim with your own insurance company first. Keep a record of all communication with your insurer. You may be eligible for federal disaster relief if the flood damage is not covered by your own insurance.

🕵️ Beware of Scams 🕵️

Disaster Survivor Assistance teams may visit door-to-door, but they will have official FEMA photo ID. Beware anyone who pressures you to buy anything or sign a contract immediately. Call the @FEMA Disaster Fraud Hotline at 866-720-5721 to report scammers.
